net.dean.jraw.http

Class RestClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dean.jraw.http.RestClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HttpClient, NetworkAccessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RedditClient

    public abstract class RestClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements HttpClient
    This class provides a high-level API to send REST-oriented HTTP requests with.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RestClient

        public RestClient(HttpAdapter httpAdapter,
          java.lang.String defaultHost,
          java.lang.String userAgent,
          int requestsPerMinute)
        Instantiates a new RestClient
        Parameters:
        defaultHost - The host that will be applied to every HttpRequest.Builder returned by request()
        userAgent - The default value of the User-Agent header
        requestsPerMinute - The amount of HTTP requests that can be sent in one minute. A value greater than 0 will enable rate limiting, one less than or equal to 0 will disable it.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultHost

        public java.lang.String getDefaultHost()
        Gets the host that will be used by default when creating new RestRequest.Builders.
        Returns:
        The default host

      • setEnforceRatelimit

        public void setEnforceRatelimit(int requestsPerMinute)
        Whether to automatically manage the execution of HTTP requests based on time (enabled by default). If there has been more than a certain amount of requests in the last minute (30 for normal API, 60 for OAuth), this class will wait to execute the next request in order to minimize the chance of Reddit IP banning this client or simply returning a 403 Forbidden.
        Parameters:
        requestsPerMinute - The amount of HTTP requests that can be sent in one minute. A value greater than 0 will enable rate limit enforcing, one less than or equal to 0 will disable it.

      • isEnforcingRatelimit

        public boolean isEnforcingRatelimit()
        Checks if the rate limit is being enforced. If true, then thread that execute(HttpRequest) is called on will block until enough time has passed
        Returns:
        If the rate limit is being enforced.

      • isHttpsDefault

        public boolean isHttpsDefault()
        Description copied from interface: HttpClient
        Checks to see if HttpRequest.Builders returned from HttpClient.request() will be executed with HTTPS. Note that this can be changed per request later.
        Specified by:
        isHttpsDefault in interface HttpClient
        Returns:
        If HTTPS will be used by default
        See Also:
        HttpRequest.Builder.https(boolean)

      • setHttpsDefault

        public void setHttpsDefault(boolean useHttpsDefault)
        Description copied from interface: HttpClient
        Sets whether or not HttpRequest.Builders returned from HttpClient.request() will be executed with HTTPS by default. Note that this can be changed per request later.
        Specified by:
        setHttpsDefault in interface HttpClient
        Parameters:
        useHttpsDefault - If HTTPS will be used by default
        See Also:
        HttpRequest.Builder.https(boolean)

      • request

        public HttpRequest.Builder request()
        Description copied from interface: HttpClient
        Creates a new HttpRequest.Builder which uses HTTPS if HttpClient.isHttpsDefault() is true, and with NetworkAccessible.getHttpAdapter()'s default headers already applied. Other properties may be applied.
        Specified by:
        request in interface HttpClient
        Returns:
        A new RestRequest Builder

      • execute

        public RestResponse execute(HttpRequest request)
                     throws NetworkException
        Description copied from interface: HttpClient
        Executes a HTTP request. HTTP Basic Authentication, rate limiting, request and response logging, and Content-Type checking will be used if applicable. If using a rate limit, this method will block until it can obtain a ticket.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface HttpClient
        Parameters:
        request - The request to send
        Returns:
        A RestResponse modeling the response sent from the server
        Throws:
        NetworkException

      • isSavingResponseHistory

        public boolean isSavingResponseHistory()
        Description copied from interface: HttpClient
        Notifies the client to log every response received. You can access this data by using HttpClient.getHistory(). This defaults to false.
        Specified by:
        isSavingResponseHistory in interface HttpClient
        Returns:
        Checks if this client is saving response history
        See Also:
        HttpClient.getHistory()

      • setSaveResponseHistory

        public void setSaveResponseHistory(boolean saveResponseHistory)
        Description copied from interface: HttpClient
        Notifies the client to log every response received. You can access this data by using HttpClient.getHistory().
        Specified by:
        setSaveResponseHistory in interface HttpClient
        Parameters:
        saveResponseHistory - Whether or not to save the HTTP responses received
        See Also:
        HttpClient.getHistory()

      • isLoggingEnabled

        public boolean isLoggingEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: HttpClient
        Checks if this RestClient is logging HTTP requests using SLF4J. The full URL, form data, and time spent sleeping are displayed also (unless it has been marked as sensitive). Enabled by default.
        Specified by:
        isLoggingEnabled in interface HttpClient
        Returns:
        If requests are being logged
        See Also:
        HttpLogger

      • setLoggingEnabled

        public void setLoggingEnabled(boolean flag)
        Description copied from interface: HttpClient
        Sets whether or not to log HTTP requests and responses. The amount of time spent waiting is also displayed. Enabled by default.
        Specified by:
        setLoggingEnabled in interface HttpClient
        Parameters:
        flag - Whether or not to log requests
        See Also:
        HttpClient.getHttpLogger()

      • getHistory

        public java.util.LinkedHashMap<RestResponse,java.util.Date> getHistory()
        Description copied from interface: HttpClient
        Gets a map of responses to Dates, in which the Date refers to the time that the response was received. Will be empty unless saving response history was enabled changed using HttpClient.setSaveResponseHistory(boolean).
        Specified by:
        getHistory in interface HttpClient
        Returns:
        The response history
